text: William Rybolt Bass (August 12, 1874 – October 25, 1951) was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at Kentucky State College—now known as the University of Kentucky—from 1898 to 1899, compiling a record of 12–2–2. As a college football player, he earned letters at Ohio Wesleyan University in 1895 and at the University of Cincinnati in 1896 and 1897. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * Category:1874 births Category:1951 deaths Category:19th-century players of American football Category:Cincinnati Bearcats football players Category:Kentucky Wildcats football coaches Category:Ohio Wesleyan Battling Bishops football players
title: W. R. Bass
